intro: Pseudocarpidium avicennioides, commonly known as the mangrove pseudocarpidium, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Southeast Asia. It is a halophyte, meaning it thrives in saline environments such as mangrove swamps and tidal mudflats. The plant has a unique root system that includes both aerial roots and submerged roots, aiding in oxygen absorption and stabilization in waterlogged soils.
